Projects

A modern dashboard for managing rental properties, tenants, and finances. Currently in development.
Status: Under active development.

Purpose: Streamline property management tasks including lease tracking, rent collection, maintenance requests, and financial reporting.

Planned Features: Multi-property support, tenant portal, automated reminders, analytics dashboard, secure document storage, and mobile-friendly design.

Tech Stack: React, Node.js, MongoDB, REST API, authentication, cloud deployment.

Why: To simplify and automate the day-to-day operations for property owners and managers, improving efficiency and transparency.
A custom-coded personal portfolio site built from scratch to showcase my work, experience, and contact info.
Technology as an Enabler: My first personal portfolio website took several months to build and had a very basic, dated appearance, with limited features and little interactivity. In contrast, this current site was developed in just two days, thanks to modern tools and frameworks. Leveraging Eleventy, Nunjucks, and custom JavaScript, I was able to quickly implement a much more engaging and interactive experience.

AI Vibe Coding: I used AI-powered vibe coding to develop this website, despite having minimal prior knowledge of JavaScript. This approach enabled rapid prototyping, troubleshooting, and feature implementation, making the development process highly efficient and accessible.

Features: The site now includes a dynamic blog page, interactive map, embedded videos, a contact form powered by Formspree, and a responsive UI with sticky sidebar navigation and collapsible panels. These enhancements were made possible by the rapid evolution of web technologies, which have dramatically reduced development time and enabled richer user experiences.

Tools Used: VS Code, Git, GitHub, Eleventy (11ty), Nunjucks, Formspree, custom CSS/JS.

Architecture: Static site generated with Eleventy, modular Nunjucks templates, global JSON data for content, assets pipeline for CSS/JS/images, deployed via GitHub Pages.

Why: I built this site to have full control over design, content, and workflow, using modern tools and best practices for maintainability and speed.

A hardware and software project to design and prototype a custom capacitive touch interface.
Overview: Developed a multi-zone capacitive touch panel for interactive control surfaces.

Tools & Technologies: Arduino, custom PCB design, capacitive sensing libraries, C/C++, 3D printing for enclosure, oscilloscope for signal analysis.

Architecture: Hardware: custom PCB with multiple touch pads, microcontroller for signal processing, USB interface for PC connectivity.
Software: firmware for real-time touch detection, debounce logic, event mapping to user actions.

Features: Multi-zone touch detection, adjustable sensitivity, plug-and-play USB interface, open-source firmware.

Applications: Used for custom control panels, musical instruments, and interactive installations.
